question: According to Locke, which power does not constitute political power?
explanation:
According to Locke, Political power is constituted by three types of Power which are as follows â€“
i)Legislative Power- It is the power to make laws for preserving and regulating the lives, activities and possessions of subject.
ii)Executive Power- It is the power to use the force to execute the laws by imposing sanctions.
iii)Federative Power- It is the power to wage wars in order to preserve the subjects and their property against other states
